data.title: List of Acronyms and Abbreviations
data.meta_description: The AMS is a global community committed to advancing weather, water, and climate science and service.
data.text:
(updated 5 August 2024)

AMS maintains this acronym reference list and no longer requires that authors submitting to our periodicals expand the scientific, model, institutional, and experiment/program acronyms appearing on the list. These lists are not meant to be comprehensive, but rather to cover those terms that we see most often and that are most familiar to our readers. We welcome community feedback ([email protected]) on list composition and any necessary corrections and updates. Authors may still include expansions in their papers, and copy and technical editors will ensure that the spelling and formatting of these expansions and their acronyms are consistent with the lists.

Standard technical abbreviations and acronyms

1D

one-dimensional

2D

two-dimensional

3D

three-dimensional

3DVAR (also variations, e.g., 3D-Var)

three-dimensional variational data assimilation

4DVAR (also variations, e.g., 4D-Var)

four-dimensional variational data assimilation

A

ABL

atmospheric boundary layer

ac

alternating current

AD

anno Domini

ADCP

acoustic Doppler current profiler

AGCM

atmospheric general circulation model

AGL

AM

AMO

ANOVA

APEX

autonomous profiling explorer

AXBT

AXCTD

airborne expendable CTD

B

BP

BT (XBT)

C

CAPE

CAT

CBL

CDF

CFL

cgs

cos

COVID-19

CTD

erf

etc.

EUV

F

Fujita scale (F#)

FAR

M

MODE

N

P

R

U

HadGEMx-yy

Hadley Centre Global Environment Model, version x (x = 1, 2, or 3)

with yy configurations for HadGEM2 and HadGEM3:

A = Atmosphere and land

AO = A and O configurations

CC = Carbon Cycle (includes AO configuration with biogeochemistry, sometimes includes CCS, with S for stratospheric processes)

ES = Earth System (includes CC configuration with chemistry)

GC = Global Coupled (e.g., HadGEM3-GC3.1 is the Global Coupled 3.1 configuration)

O = Ocean and sea ice

RA = Regional Atmosphere

HadRM3

Hadley Centre Regional Climate Model, version 3
